title: looking for a squarish humanist sans serif
content: Can anyone recommend a squarish humanist sans serif? I'm looking for a design with a thick-to-thin contrast similar to Franklin Gothic Book (notably a, b, n, and r), but less oblong/rectangular in the overall shape of the characters.
author: J. Craigen

comments.content:
Not totally sure what you're looking for but maybe [Vista Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201112025/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=200)?

I've also been really pleased with [Camingo Dos Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201112025/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/jan-fromm/camingo-dos-pro/).
This is my best list of [square sans serifs](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201112025/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/square_sans_serif/).

You could take a look at the [Comments On Camingo Typeface - Attack of the Square Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201112025/http:/typophile.com/node/28458) thread from a while back. Most of the square sans serifs aren't really very humanist, but maybe there is something in the list that you like.
